org.openimaj.image.model.asm

Class ActiveShapeModel<I extends org.openimaj.image.Image<?,I>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.model.asm.ActiveShapeModel<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - Concrete type of Image

    @References(references={@Reference(author={"Cootes, T. F.","Taylor, C. J."},title="Statistical Models of Appearance for Computer Vision",type=Unpublished,month="October",year="2001",url="http://isbe.man.ac.uk/~bim/Models/app_model.ps.gz"),@Reference(type=Inproceedings,author={"T. F. Cootes","C. J. Taylor"},title="Active Shape Models",year="1992",booktitle="in Proceedings of the British Machine Vision Conference")})
public class ActiveShapeModel<I extends org.openimaj.image.Image<?,I>>
extends Object
    Implementation of a basic Active Shape Model. The implementation allows different types of landmark appearance models and can work with both colour and greylevel images.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ActiveShapeModel.IterationResult
      Class to hold the response of a single iteration of model fitting.

    • Method Detail

      • trainModel

        public static <I extends org.openimaj.image.Image<?,I>> ActiveShapeModel<I> trainModel(org.openimaj.math.matrix.algorithm.pca.PrincipalComponentAnalysis.ComponentSelector selector,
                                                                       List<org.openimaj.util.pair.IndependentPair<org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.PointList,I>> data,
                                                                       org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.PointDistributionModel.Constraint constraint,
                                                                       LandmarkModelFactory<I> factory)
        Train a new ActiveShapeModel using the given data and parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        I - The concrete image type.
        Parameters:
        selector - the selector for choosing the number of principal components / modes of the model.
        data - the data to train the model from
        constraint - the constraint to apply to restrict the model to plausible shapes.
        factory - the LandmarkModelFactory for learning local appearance models
        Returns:
        a newly trained ActiveShapeModel.

      • performIteration

        public ActiveShapeModel.IterationResult performIteration(I image,
                                                org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.PointList currentShape)
        Perform a single iteration of model fitting.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to fit to
        currentShape - the starting shape in image coordinates
        Returns:
        the updated shape and parameters

      • fit

        public ActiveShapeModel.IterationResult fit(I image,
                                   org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.PointList initialShape)
        Iteratively apply performIteration(Image, PointList) until the maximum number of iterations is exceeded, or the number of points that moved less than 0.5 of their maximum distance in an iteration is less than the target inlier percentage.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to fit the shape to
        initialShape - the initial shape in image coordinates
        Returns:
        the fitted shape and parameters
        See Also:
        setInlierPercentage(double), setMaxIterations(int)

        public int getMaxIterations()
        Returns:
        the maxIter

      • setMaxIterations

        public void setMaxIterations(int maxIter)
        Set the maximum allowed number of iterations in fitting the model
        Parameters:
        maxIter - the maxIter to set

        public double getInlierPercentage()

        the inlierPercentage

      • setInlierPercentage

        public void setInlierPercentage(double inlierPercentage)
        Set the target percentage of the number of points that move less than 0.5 of their total possible distance within an iteration to stop fitting.
        Parameters:
        inlierPercentage - the inlierPercentage to set

      • getPDM

        public org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.PointDistributionModel getPDM()
        Returns:
        the learnt PointDistributionModel

      • getLandmarkModels

        public LandmarkModel<I>[] getLandmarkModels()
        Returns:
        the local landmark appearance models; one for each point in the shape.
